0.title: Sri Lanka will elect new Prez on July 20 as Gotabaya to step down
0.article_body: Sri Lankan parliament will elect a new president on July 20 to succeed President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana announced on Monday. The decision, which was taken at an all-party meet earlier today, comes as Rajapaksa will formally resign from the post on July 13. Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's office also confirmed that the entire Cabinet will resign.

1.title: Will not endorse anyone running to replace me as PM: Boris Johnson
1.article_body: Britain's caretaker PM Boris Johnson on Monday said that he will not endorse any contender in the race to replace him as the PM as that would damage their chances of winning. He added, "Whoever takes over from me, there is a great agenda to be continued...my job is to continue with the programme on which we were elected."

2.title: Public won't be affected by inflation in Delhi: CM Kejriwal
2.article_body: Responding to the increases in the prices of power production in Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the public will not be affected by the inflation in the city. The state government will continue its electricity subsidy scheme, providing 200 units of free electricity, he said. Those utilising 201 to 400 units of electricity receive approximately 50% subsidy.

3.title: I don't think I need the tennis, I am happy with the little things: Roger Federer
3.article_body: Ex-world number one Roger Federer, who last played competitive tennis at Wimbledon in 2021, said he doesn't think he needs the tennis. "I'm happy with the little things, like when my son does something right and when my daughter comes home with a good grade," he added. Federer stated, "I know a professional career can't last forever and that's okay."

4.title: Paytm record 8.5 million loans in Q1, 492% higher than last year
4.article_body: Mobile payment company Paytm said it recorded 8.5 million loans in first quarter of FY23, 492% higher than the same period last year. Paytm's disbursements crossed an Annualised Run Rate (ARR) of ₹24,000 crore on the platform. In June, the super app saw its highest monthly transacting users of 76 million, a 49% increase from year ago period.

5.title: Bank privatisation bill could be introduced in Monsoon Session: Report
5.article_body: The government could introduce a bill for privatisation of select-public sector banks in the upcoming Monsoon Session of the Parliament, CNBC TV18 reported. The government is awaiting the views of the Law Ministry on the proposed bill, the report said. The government may lower the minimum stake in public sector banks from 51% at present to 26%, the report added.

6.title: Was born with umbilical cord wrapped around my neck, had broken nose: Lauren
6.article_body: American dancer, actress Lauren Gottlieb opened up about her experience in a rebirth moment. She said that she was born with her umbilical cord wrapped around her neck and added that she had a slightly broken nose at birth. Lauren said that she took some time for introspection and prioritised her life with family, and her own welfare above work.

7.title: IOC, BPCL, HPCL may post combined ₹10,700 cr loss in Q1: Report
7.article_body: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum may post a combined loss of ₹10,700 crore in June quarter, ICICI Securities said in a report. The three state-owned oil marketing companies are losing ₹12-14 per litre on petrol and diesel, the report said. "We estimate gross refining margins to remain fairly strong at $17-18 per barrel levels," the brokerage added.

8.title: Virat Kohli to miss first ODI against England due to suspected groin injury: Reports
8.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has reportedly sustained a groin injury and is unlikely to play the first ODI against England, as per reports. Kohli did not come for the optional practice today ahead of the first ODI at Kennington Oval, reports added. The first ODI will take place tomorrow.

9.title: Temples submerge near Godavari river after rains in Maha's Nashik
9.article_body: Various temples submerged near the Godavari river in Maharashtra's Nashik due to incessant rain for the past three days. Several parts of Maharashtra have witnessed heavy rainfall over the past few days. Nashik received 68.4 mm average rainfall over the last 24 hours and it is likely to experience very heavy rainfall till Thursday.

10.title: Lulu's biggest Indian mall opens in UP, is made with ₹2,000cr & has 11-storey parking
10.article_body: Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall made with a ₹2,000 crore investment and spread over a 22 lakh square feet area has opened in UP's Lucknow. The mall, which has 11-storey parking, was inaugurated by UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday. It has a food court with a seating capacity of around 1,600 people with 15 fine dining restaurants and cafes.

11.title: Sanjay's 'Munnabhai' character was inspired by my character in Tezaab: Anil
11.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said in an interview that his character Munna in the 1988 hit 'Tezaab' inspired Rajkumar Hirani to write Sanjay Dutt's 'Munnabhai MBBS'. Anil mentioned his roles like 'Prem' from 'Woh Saat Din'...and 'Munna' from 'Tezaab'. He then elaborated about Munna and said, "Films were made on him because the character became so famous that they made...Munna Bhai."

12.title: What are the highest individual scores in last 10 overs of an ODI chase?
12.article_body: New Zealand's Michael Bracewell broke the record for registering the highest individual score in the last 10 overs (41 to 50) of an ODI chase. The 31-year-old scored 86 runs in the last 10 overs against Ireland to set the record. The previous record was held by Pakistan's Fakhar Zaman, who had scored 77 runs against South Africa in 2021.

13.title: Why did Djokovic's world ranking fall from 3rd to 7th despite winning Wimbledon?
13.article_body: Novak Djokovic's world ranking fell from third to seventh spot despite him winning Wimbledon. This is Djokovic's worst ranking in over four years. ATP decided to strip ranking points from Wimbledon in response to their decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. As a result, Djokovic lost 2,000 points, the most among men's singles players.

14.title: CRPF jawan holds his family hostage for 18 hrs, later shoots self
14.article_body: A CRPF jawan allegedly held his wife and six-year-old daughter hostage for more than 18 hours and fired several rounds in the air from his machine gun, before shooting himself dead in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. Jodhpur Commissioner Ravi Gaur informed that the deceased's wife and daughter are safe. As per reports, the jawan had an altercation with his senior regarding leaves.

15.title: CBI files chargesheet against MHA officials in FCRA bribery case
15.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a chargesheet against seven Home Ministry officials, among others, arrested in a Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA) bribery case, officials said. It is alleged that several officials were involved in exchanging bribes for facilitating clearances of foreign donations to NGOs in alleged violation of FCRA rules, officials had earlier said.

16.title: Bengal student leader Anis Khan was not murdered: SIT chargesheet
16.article_body: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) of West Bengal Police, probing student leader Anis Khan's death, on Monday ruled out murder as alleged by his family. The SIT, in its chargesheet, said Khan died after falling from the second floor of his home in Howrah on February 19. It has named five police personnel, charging them of negligence towards duty.

17.title: Arrest warrant was issued against me for disrobing Drapuadi: Puneet
17.article_body: Actor Puneet Issar, who portrayed Duryodhan in television series 'Mahabharat', revealed that a non-bailable arrest warrant was issued against him over the 'cheer haran' of Draupadi. "Someone from [Varanasi] had said that the disrobing of Draupadi that you did has caused hurt to us," he said. Puneet added that the person had wanted pictures with the actors of the show.

18.title: It lacked great brilliance: Toni Nadal on Djokovic-Kyrgios Wimbledon final
18.article_body: Analysing 2022 Wimbledon final between winner Novak Djokovic and runner-up Nick Kyrgios, Rafael Nadal's uncle Toni Nadal said it lacked great brilliance because there were too many points not played. He added that Djokovic once again proved that he is a great champion without the need to display his most "dazzling" game. Djokovic won his seventh Wimbledon title on Sunday.

19.title: Ready to lead new govt: Sri Lankan Oppn party SJB amid protests
19.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) on Monday said that it's ready to lead new government to bring stability amid ongoing protests due to country's economic crisis. The announcement, which was made by SJB leader Sajith Premadasa, came after PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's office said that entire Cabinet will resign. Sri Lankan President will step down on July 13.

20.title: Shinzo Abe's party wins majority in polls held after his assassination
20.article_body: Ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), which is also Japan's ruling party, has bagged a majority in the parliamentary polls held two days after his assassination. LDP-Komeito coalition has secured 76 seats in the upper house of the parliament. Abe was campaigning for an LDP candidate in Nara city when he was shot dead on July 8.

21.title: Haryana govt increases security of MLAs who received threat calls
21.article_body: The Haryana government has increased the security of MLAs who have allegedly received death threats over phone calls recently. Haryana Legislative Assembly Speaker GC Gupta said, "Our five-six MLAs have received death threats. We're taking this seriously." Gupta added that he has discussed the matter with Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar and the Director General of Police.

22.title: Scam 1992 fame Shreya takes Mumbai train; complains of unreasonable cab fares
22.article_body: 'Scam 1992' fame Shreya Dhanwanthary visited the southern part of Mumbai. She posted how she travelled via train as it's way cheaper and takes way less time than the "unreasonable cabs". Shreya wrote on Instagram Story, “Local beats unreasonable cab fares and travel time. The fare was ₹1500!!! What in the world? What do they think?"

23.title: Massive congratulations: Jayawardena on SL's innings and 39-run win vs Aus
23.article_body: After Sri Lanka won second Test by an innings and 39 runs against Australia in Galle, Mahela Jayawardena tweeted, "Well played Sri Lanka." He added, "Massive congratulations to Dimuth Karunarathna, the team and support staff. Also to the selectors who had to make some tough decisions with COVID cases in the squad." The two-match series ended in a 1-1 draw.

24.title: Varun Dhawan celebrates 8 years of 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania'
24.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a series of posts to mark eight years since the release of 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania'. He wrote alongside one of the pictures, "Some great memories with amazing people." The film also features actress Alia Bhatt and late actor Sidharth Shukla. Varun also shared director Shashank Khaitan's story.

25.title: Fabulous innings, shame it came in a losing cause: Giles on Suryakumar's 117
25.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles called India batter Suryakumar Yadav's 55-ball 117 in the third T20I against England "fabulous". He added, "Just a shame it came in a losing cause." India lost by 17 runs. He further said that Suryakumar played classy innings under pressure after India were reduced to 31/3. He hit 14 fours and six sixes during his knock.

26.title: RBI unveils mechanism to settle international trade payments in Indian rupee
26.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday unveiled a system for international trade settlements in the Indian rupee. The new system will be put in place to "promote the growth of global trade" and "support the increasing interest of the global trading community in INR", RBI said. The system allows for invoicing, payment and settlement of exports/imports in INR.

27.title: Jubliant FoodWorks' ex-CEO Pota to lead Advent-backed Eureka Forbes
27.article_body: Pratik Pota, the former CEO of Jubilant FoodWorks Ltd (JFL), will lead Advent International's portfolio company, Eureka Forbes. Pota will take on the role of Managing Director and CEO of Eureka Forbes from August 16 and lead the management team to continue scaling the business, Advent announced. Before JFL, he held leadership roles in PepsiCo, Airtel and Hindustan Unilever.

28.title: Man lands small plane on busy highway in US after engine failure, video goes viral
28.article_body: A video has gone viral online showing a man landing a single-engine plane on a busy highway in US after the engine started to fail. The video was filmed on the pilot's GoPro camera. In the video, several cars can be seen travelling on the four-lane highway in North Carolina. The man had less than 100 hours of air experience.

29.title: I watched Chak De India to stay motivated for Shabaash Mithu: Taapsee
29.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said that she watched 'Chak De India' to get motivation for her film 'Shabaash Mithu'. "I need encouragement or inspiration. For this film, especially 'Shabaash Mithu', there were so many times I used to tell my colleagues...we should watch 'Chak De' before we start filming our climax to get into that zone," she said.

30.title: Sena's 16 MPs tell Uddhav to back NDA's President pick Murmu: MP
30.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Gajanan Kirtikar said 16 MPs of the party, who had attended a meeting called by Uddhav Thackeray on Monday, requested the former Maharashtra CM to support NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "She is an NDA candidate but Droupadi Murmu belongs to the tribal community and is a woman," ANI quoted Kirtikar as saying.

31.title: Congress MP Manish Tewari refuses to sign Oppn's letter on Agnipath
31.article_body: Congress MP Manish Tewari on Monday refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the seven Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh earlier today, was the only one to not sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme. Notably, Tewari had earlier termed the scheme "reform in right direction".

32.title: 4 more dead in Amarnath cloudburst identified as Rajasthan residents
32.article_body: Four more people killed in the July 8 Amarnath flash floods have been identified as residents of Rajasthan's Nagaur. With this, the death toll in the incident from the state rose to seven. At least 16 people died and several went missing in the flash floods triggered by a cloudburst last Friday.

33.title: Punjab govt cancels textile park near Ludhiana's Mattewara forest
33.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann announced on Monday that the proposed 1,000-acre textile park project near Ludhiana's Mattewara forest has been cancelled. He further said that no industry will be allowed to come up on the river banks of Punjab to avoid any sort of water pollution. This comes after over 10,000 people assembled at the project site in protest.

34.title: Meat thrown in gurdwara premises in UP's Bareilly; case lodged
34.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly have registered a case after meat was allegedly thrown into the premises of a gurdwara, a senior police officer said on Monday. Some miscreants tried to spoil the atmosphere of the city on Sunday night amid Eid al-Adha celebrations, he added. Police said a crowd had gathered at the spot after the meat was found.

35.title: G20 watchdog to propose first global crypto rules in October
35.article_body: The Financial Stability Board (FSB) said on Monday that it'll propose the first global cryptocurrency rules in October, following the recent market volatility. "The failure of a market player, in addition to imposing...large losses on investors...can...transmit risks to other parts of the crypto-asset ecosystem," FSB said. The FSB will report to G20 Finance Ministers and central bank Governors.

36.title: 'Population imbalance' shouldn't be allowed to happen: UP CM Yogi
36.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said the population control programme must go ahead successfully, adding that "population imbalance" should not be allowed to happen. Having skilled manpower is an achievement for society, but when there are diseases and a shortage of resources, population explosion becomes a challenge of its own, the CM's office tweeted in Hindi.

37.title: Shinzo Abe's attacker referred to YouTube to make firearms: Reports
37.article_body: Tetsuya Yamagami, the attacker who shot dead ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe on July 8, referred to YouTube videos while making the firearm used in the attack, local media reported. Yamagami said he had tested the gun at a facility connected to a religious group he believes Abe was associated with. Abe was killed while delivering a speech in Nara city.

38.title: Bengaluru school shut for 2 years denying TCs to students: Report
38.article_body: Godwin English School in Bengaluru, which has been defunct for the last two years, hasn't issued transfer certificates (TCs) to 25 students, The News Minute reported. However, school authorities have reportedly been calling parents to demand money for the issuance of the certificates. The students have reportedly been unable to secure admissions elsewhere for two years because of this reason.

39.title: FIR against unidentified persons over objectionable hoardings on PM Modi
39.article_body: Police have filed an FIR against unidentified persons after objectionable hoardings and comments on Prime Minister Narendra Modi came up opposite police lines in Uttar Pradesh's Colonelganj. The hoardings featured the hashtag #ByeByeModi and included references to the revoked farm laws, contract jobs and the rising cost of cooking gas. Police are scanning CCTV footage to identify those involved.

40.title: Crypto lender Celsius considers bankruptcy filing: Report
40.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Celsius is considering filing for bankruptcy as it hired new lawyers for restructuring advice, The Wall Street Journal reported. The crypto firm has brought on lawyers from Kirkland & Ellis LLP to advise on options, including a bankruptcy filing, the report said. This comes after the company froze customer transfers and withdrawals citing "extreme market conditions".

41.title: Babar Azam looks a million dollars in modern-day cricket: Younis
41.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Waqar Younis lauded Babar Azam, saying that the Pakistan captain looks like a "million dollars" in modern-day cricket. "He's definitely as good as all the big names. Babar is still very young and has plenty of cricket ahead of him," he added. In ICC batting rankings, Babar is currently ranked fourth in Tests, first in ODIs and T20Is.

42.title: Sidhu Moosewala's killing shouldn't be given political colour: Supreme Court
42.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday while hearing pleas linked to singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, said, "Our request is that such matters should not be connected politically." The bench said, "We don't appreciate this. This court has to work openly for all the people. But it should not be given any political colour." It dismissed a plea seeking a CBI probe.

43.title: Aaditya Thackeray brings kids to Aarey protests, NCPCR seeks FIR
43.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) sought an FIR against Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray for allegedly using children during 'Save Aarey' protests. The child rights body asked Mumbai Police to submit an Action Taken Report, along with the statement of the children within 3 days. The commission asked the police to investigate the matter urgently.

44.title: BYJU'S struggles to close $800 million funding round
44.article_body: BYJU'S is struggling to close a funding round of $800 million. A spokeswoman said on Monday that investors, including Sumeru Ventures and Oxshott, haven't transferred about $250 million of the targeted amount due to "macroeconomic reasons". However, the firm's Co-founder Byju Raveendran has completed an injection of about $400 million into the startup as part of the round, she added.

45.title: Ashish Bhatia and Nandini win Sonu Sood-hosted MTV Roadies 18
45.article_body: Ashish Bhatia and Nandini have emerged winners of the Sonu Sood-hosted MTV Roadies 18. Apart from Ashish and Nandini, the other finalists included Kevin Almasifar-Moose Jattana, Yukti Arora-Jaswanth Bopanna and Gaurav Alugh-Simi Talsania. The season of the show was shot in South Africa's Cape Town. "I cannot describe how amazing this is for me," Nandini said.

46.title: I wanted to encourage him: Fan accused of having 700 drinks by Kyrgios at Wimbledon final
46.article_body: The fan accused by Nick Kyrgios of having '700 drinks' during the Wimbledon men's final said that she "only had good intentions". The fan, who was ejected for distracting Kyrgios, added, "He always says the crowd is against him, and I wanted to show we were for him, I wanted to encourage him."

47.title: Rising Chinese invasion & PM's silence harmful for country: Rahul
47.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that the increasing Chinese infiltration and PM Modi's silence on it are "very harmful" for the country. He also shared five "truths" about PM Modi, alleging that he's afraid of China, hides the truth from the public, lowers the morale of the Army and plays with the security of the country.

48.title: Digital health platform MFine merges with LifeCell International
48.article_body: Digital healthcare startup MFine will merge with the diagnostic arm of Chennai-based LifeCell International to form a merged entity called LifeWell, according to the company's Co-founder Prasad Kompalli. LifeWell has raised $80 million from New York-based healthcare investment firm OrbiMed.  Bengaluru-based MFine was founded by former Myntra executives Prasad Kompalli and Ashutosh Lawania in 2017.

49.title: Centre, K'taka govt hold 2-day good governance conference in B'luru
49.article_body: Centre in collaboration with the Karnataka government is holding a two-day conference in Bengaluru from Monday on bringing citizens and government closer through administrative reforms, a PIB release said. Union Minister Jitendra Singh and Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai will grace the valedictory session of "Bringing citizens, entrepreneurs and government closer for good governance" on Tuesday.

50.title: Ambulance service suspended in parts of Sri Lanka amid fuel crisis
50.article_body: Amid fuel shortages in crisis-hit Sri Lanka, emergency ambulance service has been suspended in several parts of the country. Suwa Seriya Ambulance Service has urged citizens to refrain from calling emergency helpline number 1990 in the affected regions, which include Galle and Hambantota. Sri Lankan Power Minister Kanchana Wijesekera has said that fuel supplies can be expected in few days.

51.title: ED issues fresh summons to Sonia in National Herald case on July 21
51.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has asked Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to appear before it on July 21 for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case. Earlier, she had asked ED to postpone the questioning as she was advised to rest after contracting COVID-19. Her son and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been questioned by the ED in this case.

52.title: Still thinking about 'RRR' days later: 'Doctor Strange' screenwriter
52.article_body: Screenwriter Jon Spaihts, known for writing 'Doctor Strange' and 'Dune', praised Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR'. He shared a still from the movie on Twitter, writing "Holy hell, RRR. Has any movie ever packed more movie into a movie? What a ride. Still thinking about it a couple days later." The SS Rajamouli directorial earned over ₹1,200 crore worldwide.

53.title: The game is fickle: Topley on England's 17-run win vs India in 3rd T20I
53.article_body: After his side's 17-run win against India in third T20I, England pacer Reece Topley, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 3/22, said that the game is fickle. "You got to ride the high when things fall your way because a lot of days it does not...you got to trust your processes and keep delivering," he added.

54.title: Rape accused Hyd Police inspector surrenders, taken in custody
54.article_body: Hyderabad Police inspector K Nageshwar Rao, who has been booked for the alleged rape of a woman, surrendered before Rachakonda Police on Sunday. Rao, who had been absconding for 24 hours, was taken in custody by a Special Operations Team and Vanasthalipuram police. The case is being investigated by Vanasthalipuram ACP, police said.

55.title: Osmania and JNTU postpone exams amid heavy rainfall in Hyderabad
55.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University (JNTU) and Osmania University (OU) have announced the postponement of exams amid heavy rainfall in Hyderabad. JNTU has postponed the various exams of its BTech and BPharm courses scheduled for July 11 and 12. Exams scheduled from July 16 onwards will remain unaffected. Meanwhile, Osmania has postponed exams scheduled from July 11 to July 13.

56.title: New Parliament will fulfil hopes, aspirations of people: Shah
56.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that the new Parliament building will "become the identity of a self-reliant and new India and will witness the fulfilment of the hopes and aspirations of the people". PM Modi unveiled the National Emblem at the summit of the new Parliament House, which is made of bronze and weighs 9,500 kg.

57.title: You left so much behind: B Praak's wife on losing her second child at birth
57.article_body: Singer B Praak's wife Meera Bachan, who lost her second child at birth last month, shared a post while remembering her child. She wrote, "You will always be my heart and soul, my...heartbeat, my blood...my child, my reason for being and living. You gave me a second life and left so much behind. I'll miss you until we meet again."

58.title: 2 Pune-based scientists win bronze medals in CRSI 2023 awards
58.article_body: Two scientists from Pune have been selected to receive Chemical Research Society of India (CRSI) Bronze Medal of 2023. Sakya Sen and Sujit Ghosh, from CSIR-National Chemical Laboratory (NCL) and Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER) Pune, are among the 30 national-level awardees this year. Gold medals will be presented to Professor Vishwakarma Singh and Professor Ramasesha.

59.title: 6 Thane trekkers lost way in Pune's Bhimashankar forest, rescued
59.article_body: The Pune Rural Police have rescued six trekkers from Thane, who lost their way in Pune's Bhimashankar forest amid heavy rains on Sunday evening. Officials were dispatched to the area after the owner of a local eatery informed them about the situation. The trekkers were stuck in the difficult terrain of high gradient slopes and dangerous cliffs, officials said.

60.title: AAP MP Raghav Chadha appointed Chairman of Punjab advisory panel
60.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has appointed AAP MP Raghav Chadha as the Chairman of a temporary advisory committee to the state government. Chadha will oversee the conception and implementation of pro-people initiatives of the AAP government in the state and advise it on matters of finance, the Chief Minister's Office said.

61.title: Landslide on road leading to Pune's Bhimashankar Temple; no one injured
61.article_body: A landslide took place on a road leading to the Bhimashankar Temple in the Pune district after heavy rains on Monday, officials said. No one was injured in the incident, an official said. The Ghodegaon-Bhimashankar road was partially blocked due to the landslide, but one side of the road was open for vehicular movement.

62.title: One of the oldest Indian tigers, Raja, dies at 25; pic shows tribute being paid to it
62.article_body: Raja, one of the longest-surviving tigers in India, died aged 25 years and 10 months on Monday. The tiger died at 3 am in West Bengal, after which pictures showed people paying tribute to it by laying flower wreaths on its mortal remains. Tigers usually live up to 16 years in the wild and up to 28-30 years in captivity.

63.title: Part of temple collapses amid heavy rainfall in Gujarat, no injuries reported
63.article_body: A part of the Arjunnath temple in Gujarat collapsed on Monday amid heavy rainfall in the state. The Lord Shiva temple is located on the banks of a river in Sankheda. No injuries have been reported following the collapse of a portion of the temple. Over 3,000 people have been evacuated from Gujarat as heavy rainfall is likely to continue.

64.title: Coal India's capital expenditure rises 65% in June quarter
64.article_body: Coal India on Monday said its capital expenditure increased by 65% to ₹3,034 crore in the June quarter of 2022-23. In comparison, its capital expenditure was ₹1,841 crore in the April-June period of last financial year. The increase was driven by strong spending in acquiring land and strengthening transport infrastructure in the coalfields under first-mile connectivity projects, the company said.

65.title: Kohli is not far off from a real special innings: Vaughan
65.article_body: Michael Vaughan has said the "pinnacle point" in the upcoming three-match ODI series between India and England will be Virat Kohli. "India need Virat back to form. They need him to score runs...I've seen glimpses that he is not far off from a real special innings," he added. Kohli scored 1, 11 in recently concluded three-match T20I series against England.

66.title: Blinkit promotes long-time executive Rishi Arora to Co-founder: Report
66.article_body: Quick commerce startup, Blinkit, promoted long-time executive Rishi Arora to Co-founder, two months prior to its acquisition by Zomato, as per a report. Prior to this, Arora had been working as a senior Vice President of Operations for 8 years at the company. Blinkit has also named former Zomato Engineering Manager, Sajal Gupta, as the Chief Technology Officer (CTO).

67.title: You are creating history: PM to Shramjeevis building new Parliament
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi interacted with workers involved in the construction work of the new Parliament and said that they're making history. "I had a wonderful interaction with the Shramjeevis who have been involved in the making of the Parliament. We are proud of their efforts and will always remember their contribution to our nation," PM Modi said in a tweet.

68.title: Huge flashlight caused by meteor seen in Chile's night sky, pic goes viral
68.article_body: A meteor was recently spotted causing huge flashlight through the night sky over Chile's Santiago. Academics at the Concepción University said that it was a small rock body that burned up upon entering the Earth’s atmosphere. According to local media, the bright flashes of light were accompanied with loud booming sounds.

69.title: Storage in dams supplying water to Pune city increases to 8.70 TMC
69.article_body: Storage in the dams supplying water to Pune city has risen to 8.70 TMC because of a good spell of rain for the last one week, officials said. More rains have been predicted for the next few days in the catchment area of these dams. The water storage was 8.63 TMC last year on the same day, according to officials.

70.title: 5 popular Delhi markets to be revamped, govt to conduct online survey
70.article_body: The Delhi government has begun preliminary work towards revamping five popular markets. The governments will be conducting an online survey of traders of all the five markets to take stock of facilities. Kamla Nagar, Sarojini Nagar, Khari Baoli spice market, Lajpat Nagar and Kirti Nagar furniture markets will be revamped under the project.

71.title: Dileep is innocent in 2017 actress assault case: Former Kerala DGP
71.article_body: Former Kerala Director General of Police Sreelekha claimed on her YouTube channel that Malayalam actor Dileep is 100% innocent and not at all involved in the 2017 actress assault case. Sreelekha further said most of the evidence against Dileep has been fabricated by co-accused Pulsar Suni and his "quotation gang". She alleged police helped Pulsar secure a mobile in prison.

72.title: Pune college introduces course on setting up terrace gardens
72.article_body: Pune's Modern College of Arts, Science and Commerce has decided to introduce a certificate course on setting up terrace gardens. The course will begin on August 15 and the registrations will start in the first week of August. Candidates will be chosen on a first-come-first-serve basis and the course will be open to all students, pensioners, working professionals and homemakers.

73.title: Bihar's Purnea alerted over reports of Nairobi fly attacks in Bengal
73.article_body: The Purnea health administration was on Monday put on high alert over reports of Nairobi fly attacks in Bihar through West Bengal. Medical officers have been directed to spread awareness about how to deal with possible attacks. On July 5, around 100 students of a college in Sikkim suffered from severe skin infections after coming in contact with the flies.

74.title: Heavy rain in Gujarat disrupts power supply in 174 villages
74.article_body: At least 174 villages across Gujarat lost power supply in the heavy rain that affected parts of Gujarat on Sunday. According to IMD, Chhota Udepur received over 166 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours. This is the second-highest rainfall after the Narmada district, which received 168 mm in the last 24 hours, ending at 8 am on Monday.

75.title: SpiceJet refutes reports of surprise check by DGCA & windshield crack incident
75.article_body: SpiceJet on Monday refuted reports that claimed that the windshield of one of its aircraft cracked minutes after departure from Chennai, while another flight was delayed by six hours after DGCA’s surprise inspection. On July 9, media reports emerged that a SpiceJet flight from Mumbai to Srinagar was delayed for six hours because of DGCA's surprise audit of the aircraft.

76.title: 3 men, aged 22-26, drown in waterfall in UP's Mirzapur
76.article_body: Three young men drowned in the Chuna Dari waterfall in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district. The waterfall was immediately closed for the tourists after the incident and rescue operations went underway, police said. The deceased, identified as Sandeep Kharwar (26), Prince (23) and Rishu (22), had come from Varanasi. Notably, the three deceased didn't know how to swim, police added.

77.title: 3 people gored during 5th bull run at festival in Spain's Pamplona
77.article_body: Three people were gored and three others were bruised during the fifth bull run at Pamplona's San Fermín Festival in Spain on Monday, a Spanish Red Cross spokesperson said. While there will be three more bull runs till Thursday, this is the first one in which someone was gored this year. One of the gored people is Australian.

78.title: Have over ₹2,800 cr in our bank yet we aren’t efficient: Unacademy CEO tells staff
78.article_body: In an internal note to the employees, Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal announced a series of cost-cutting measures. He said, "Even though we have over ₹2,800 crore in the bank, we aren't efficient at all...There are a lot of unnecessary expenses we do...We must turn profitable asap." "These changes might seem we are in a bad state...We are not," he added.

79.title: Russian shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv killed 3, injured 31: Guv
79.article_body: Three people were killed and 31 others were injured due to shelling by Russian forces in Ukraine's Kharkiv, the regional governor claimed. The city's Mayor Ihor Terekhov said that the shelling hit places "which had no military significance". He added that two children aged four and 16 were among the people who were taken to a hospital.

80.title: Woman killed after jumping in front of metro in Kolkata, services disrupted
80.article_body: A woman died after jumping in front of an approaching metro train at Girish Park station in West Bengal's Kolkata on Monday. The incident occurred around 12:35 pm and metro services were disrupted for around 50 minutes. Officials said they are trying to identify the woman and find her family members. They are investigating the matter and checking CCTV footage.

81.title: No free meals for staff, founders & top management to take salary cut: Unacademy
81.article_body: In an internal note to the staff, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal said that firm's founders and top management will take pay cuts, and the company will also shut its global test preparation business in a bid to turn profitable. He also put travel restrictions on employees, removed dedicated drivers for CXOs and stopped complimentary meals and snacks at their offices.

82.title: Centre should invite Oppn to events related to Parliament: Ex-Cong MP
82.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi unveiled the National Emblem on the new Parliament building on Monday, ex-Congress MP Sandeep Dikshit said the Centre should invite Opposition leaders as well to the events and functions related to the Parliament. "The Parliament does not belong to a single party, government or a PM...It belongs to every elected member of the Parliament," he added.

83.title: We've stable govt, don't need anyone: Goa CM on Cong's defection accusation
83.article_body: After AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said a "conspiracy" was led by two of their leaders by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "We don't need anyone, we've a stable government with support of 25 MLAs." Furthermore, he said, "Since they (Congress) have nothing to do, they're doing this blame-game drama."

84.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's judicial custody extended till July 20
84.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday extended Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's judicial custody till July 20 in a money laundering case. ED has carried out at least two rounds of raids against his family members and associates. The probe agency claimed to have seized cash worth ₹2.85 crore and 133 gold coins after raids conducted against his family and others.

85.title: Suryakumar needed supporting role from someone in his 117-run innings: Sehwag
85.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said Suryakumar Yadav needed "supporting role" from other batters in his 117-run innings in the third T20I against England. "Shreyas did support him for some time, but the batters after that did not give him company. Such a knock would have looked better if it was on the winning side," stated Sehwag. Shreyas scored 28(23).

86.title: TDP will back Murmu for Presidential polls: Chandrababu Naidu
86.article_body: Telugu Desam Party chief and former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu said that his party will vote for NDA's Droupadi Murmu in the upcoming Presidential polls. Naidu said that it would be "wonderful to see her [Murmu]" become the first tribal woman President. With this, Andhra Pradesh's two main political parties, YSRCP and TDP, have declared to support Murmu.

87.title: Over 3,000 people evacuated amid heavy rains in Gujarat: Officials
87.article_body: Over 3,000 people have been evacuated from Gujarat as heavy rains lashed the state and the meteorological department's forecast showed that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely to continue over the next five days in several districts. Officials said that 400 people have been evacuated from Chhotaudepur, which received 433 mm of rainfall in just 12 hours.

88.title: Who is Sneha Pareek, the only girl JEE Main 2022 topper who scored 300/300?
88.article_body: Out of the 14 students who scored 100 percentile in JEE Main 2022 Session 1, Guwahati’s Sneha Pareek is the only girl topper who scored 300/300. She wants to pursue BTech in Computer Science. "I'm willing to join any IIT that offers my desired course. If it comes as a preferred choice, I will opt for IIT-Bombay," she said.

89.title: 'Dhaakad' was removed from cinemas even before I could watch it: Saswata
89.article_body: Saswata Chatterjee, who was recently seen in Kangana Ranaut-fronted 'Dhaakad', has said he fails to understand why the movie didn't work. "It was a big project. It was removed from [cinemas]...even before I could watch it," he added. 'Dhaakad', which was made on an estimated budget of ₹85 crore, managed to earn only ₹2.58 crore in India, according to reports.

90.title: Abe killed by ex-serviceman, BJP playing with fire on Agnipath: TMC
90.article_body: The TMC has cautioned Centre over new military recruitment scheme Agnipath by pointing out that ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated by a short-service ex-serviceman. "BJP is playing with fire in the name of Agnipath...We have seen what...happened in Japan," TMC's Kunal Ghosh said. Abe's attacker reportedly lost his job in Japanese Maritime Self-Defence Force after three years of service.

91.title: Rupee closes at new all-time low of 79.44 against US dollar
91.article_body: The rupee ended at a new all-time low of nearly 79.44 per US dollar on Monday. The currency on Monday opened at 79.30 against the US dollar and witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24 and a low of 79.49. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex ended 86.61 points lower at 54,395.23, while NSE Nifty declined 4.60 points on Monday.

92.title: IFS officer shares video of cobra hiding in a shoe, says 'be careful in monsoon'
92.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda has shared a video of a cobra hiding inside a shoe and tweeted, "You will find them at oddest possible places in monsoons. Be careful. Take help of trained personnel." The video showed the snake being rescued by a trained official, who advised people to always shake their shoes before wearing.

93.title: We weren't prepared for animal that it was: Ranbir on Brahmastra getting delayed
93.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, while speaking about the delay in the release of 'Brahmastra', said, "I think when we started...[it], we weren't prepared for the animal that it was." "It had too many special effects...and where the story was, we didn't expect that...So we were learning as we were making it," he added. The film is scheduled to release on September 9.

94.title: Anil to host a Bohemian-themed baby shower for Sonam Kapoor: Report
94.article_body: Anil Kapoor and Sunita Kapoor will be hosting a  Bohemian-themed baby shower for their daughter Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, according to a report. The actress is expecting her first child with her husband Anand Ahuja. The baby shower will reportedly be hosted at Sunita's sister Kavita Singh's Rockdale mansion in Bandra, where Sonam and Anand Ahuja got married.

95.title: Vauld's users to continue earning interest on crypto FDs: CEO
95.article_body: Crypto lending platform Vauld's users will continue to earn interest on their fixed crypto deposits, its CEO Darshan Bathija confirmed. Bathija's clarification comes after the company suspended withdrawals and deposits citing volatile conditions in the crypto market. On resuming withdrawal deposit options, he said he can't provide fixed timelines yet but is working to resume operations soon.

96.title: 5-yr-old Mumbai boy falls to death from window of 11th-floor-flat
96.article_body: A five-year-old boy fell from the window of his 11th floor flat in a housing society in Mumbai's Byculla area on Sunday while he was playing with an umbrella, police said. The boy was near his bed and his mother and relatives were in the same room when the incident occurred in the morning, an official said.

97.title: Journalists barred from entering Odisha schools, Education Min criticises move
97.article_body: The Odisha government banned the entry of journalists into schools in some areas after news channels showed how students were poor in mathematics. Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticised the move, saying the press is the fourth pillar of democracy and cannot be stopped from entering a public institution. The news channels showed class 5 students unable to recollect tables.

98.title: 'Stay single like me', says Nagaland minister on World Population Day; tweet viral
98.article_body: Nagaland's Higher Education and Tribal Affairs Minister Temjen Along's tweet on World Population Day has gone viral. "Let's be sensible towards the issues of population growth and inculcate informed choices on childbearing," said Along, adding, "Or #StaySingle like me and together we can contribute towards a sustainable future." Along's speech on 'benefits of small eyes' had earlier gone viral.

99.title: Goa Congress MLAs being offered ₹50 cr by BJP to join party: Siddaramaiah
99.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah alleged that BJP is offering ₹50 crores to Goa Congress MLAs and said that by doing this they (BJP) are not believing in democracy. "Not only in Goa, everywhere they do Operation Kamala. They will offer money, they will purchase MLAs," the Congress leader said. It's not possible for BJP to do this in Karnataka, he added.

100.title: Sri Lankan PM holds Cabinet meeting as PMO confirms Prez's resignation
100.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe held a Cabinet meeting with all the ministers at the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) on Monday, the PM's media unit said. It added that all ministers maintained that they'll hand over their responsibilities "as soon as there's an agreement to form an All-Party Government". This comes as Sri Lanka's PMO officially confirmed the President's resignation.

101.title: 94-yr-old Bhagwani wins 1 gold, 2 bronze medals at 2022 World Masters Athletics C'ships
101.article_body: Bhagwani Devi Dagar, a 94-year-old woman from India, bagged a gold medal and two bronze medals at the World Masters Athletics Championships 2022. The Indian athlete won the gold medal in the 100-metre sprint event, which she ran in 24.74 seconds. She bagged one of her two bronze medals in shot put.

102.title: Modi is weakest PM; 'undeclared emergency' under his rule: CM KCR
102.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said that PM Narendra Modi is the weakest and most inefficient Indian PM of all time. CM Rao also said that there is an "undeclared Emergency" in India under PM Modi's rule. "During the Congress rule, there was brain-drain. Now, with BJP's policies, there is a capital drain, resulting in depleting forex reserves," he added.

103.title: Police seizes truck carrying gutkha worth ₹91 lakh in Pune
103.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police intercepted a truck carrying banned gutkha worth ₹91 lakh at the Pune-Nashik highway on Sunday. The officials of the Chakan Police Station arrested the truck driver, Ganesh Bhadale (32), by laying a trap in the Waki Khurd area. Notably, since 2020, the Pimpri Chinchwad Police have seized gutkha and paan masala products worth over ₹10 crores.

104.title: UP man on Interpol's 'red notice' arrested at Delhi's IGI airport
104.article_body: Noida Police's Special Task Force arrested a UP man, who had been missing for eight years and had been on Interpol's 'red notice' from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Sunday, officials said. The accused had killed a man and robbed his motorcycle in 2013. According to police, he got a fake passport in 2016 and escaped to Saudi Arabia.

105.title: Kohli shouldn't be dropped, he can single-handedly win you WC: Sarandeep
105.article_body: Ex-Team India selector Sarandeep Singh has said Virat Kohli shouldn't be dropped from India's T20I squad ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Everybody knows his capabilities and his potential. He can single-handedly win you World Cup," he stated. Sarandeep also questioned the rest being given to Kohli, stating that playing is the only way to get back to form.

106.title: Quite a few brilliant shots: Tendulkar on Suryakumar's 117 in Nottingham
106.article_body: Praising India batter Suryakumar Yadav following his ton in the third T20I against England in Nottingham, Sachin Tendulkar said, "Amazing hundred." He tweeted, "There were quite a few brilliant shots but those scoop sixes over point were just spectacular." Suryakumar scored 117 runs off 55 deliveries. It was Suryakumar's maiden T20I century. England beat India by 17 runs.

107.title: 2 terrorists, including top JeM commander, killed in J&K's Awantipora
107.article_body: At least two terrorists belonging to terror group Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Awantipora on Monday. One of the terrorists has been identified as top JeM commander Kaiser Koka while the identity of the other is being ascertained, police said. Incriminating materials, arms and ammunition including a US-made rifle among others have been recovered.

108.title: Ex-Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains surrenders before court in rape case
108.article_body: Former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains on Monday surrendered before a court in Punjab's Ludhiana in connection with a rape case, Joint Commissioner Ravcharan Singh Brar has confirmed. Police took custody of Simarjeet, whose younger brother Karamjit Singh Bains and aide Sukhchain Singh are already in jail in the case.

109.title: I had tested for Dayaben's role, not sure I'm doing it: Aishwarya
109.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Sakhuja has stated that she had tested for the role of Dayaben for the television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', adding that she doesn't think she is doing it. The makers of the show had confirmed that the character will be returning to the show but actress Disha Vakani will not be portraying her.

110.title: It won't be easy for Pakistan to beat India this time: Shoaib Akhtar
110.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said it won't be "easy" for the Babar Azam-led side to beat Team India in the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "India will come up with proper planning this time around," he stated. Pakistan had defeated India by 10 wickets in the 2021 T20 World Cup in UAE.

111.title: Biotech startup String Bio raises $20 mn in Series B funding round
111.article_body: Biotech startup String Bio raised $20 million in its Series B funding round from Woodside Energy, Ankur Capital, Dare Ventures, Redstart and Zenfold Ventures. The Bengaluru-based startup has also signed an agreement with Australia's Woodside Energy for producing sustainable protein ingredients from greenhouse gases. The company uses biotechnology to produce animal feed and food ingredients.

112.title: It was physically exhausting: Nora on directing song 'Dirty Little Secret'
112.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi, who turned director and choreographer for her international single 'Dirty Little Secret', opened up about the challenges of being behind the camera. Nora said, "It requires...lot of pre-planning." "It was physically exhausting, especially the last day of the shoot. We shot for around 20 hours. [I had to make sure]...the dancers were in sync," she added.

113.title: Panneerselvam's supporters slap slippers at Palaniswami's photo in Chennai
113.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam’s supporters slapped slippers at Edappadi K Palaniswami’s photo as they protested AIADMK’s General Council meeting in Vanagaram, Chennai on Monday. Panneerselvam was expelled from all posts of AIADMK after Palaniswami took control of party as its interim General Secretary. Earlier today, supporters of both leaders clashed near party’s headquarters in Chennai.

114.title: 24 gamblers detained in Bengaluru, over ₹2.5 lakh cash seized
114.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) in Bengaluru detained 24 gamblers in the city and seized over ₹2.5 lakh in cash from their possession. The gambling games were organised in Vidyaranyapura and Halasuru Gate police station areas. Last week, the Crime Branch arrested three people for selling drugs and seized items worth ₹83 lakh from the accused.

115.title: Razorpay, Pine Labs among 1st firms to get RBI's payment aggregator, gateway licences
115.article_body: Online payment providers Razorpay and Pine Labs are among the first companies to receive in-principle approval from RBI for payment aggregator (PA) and payment gateway (PG) licences. The RBI has asked the companies to conduct an audit within the next six months for final approval. Companies like BharatPe, PhonePe and Amazon, among others, too applied for the licences.

116.title: Can't allow mindset of 1 person having 10 children: Giriraj Singh
116.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh said that there is an urgent need for a stringent law on population control. "We have limited resources. Our population is expanding like the mouth of Sursa (mythical female demon)," Giriraj said on the occasion of World Population Day. He added, "The perverse mindset out of which one person sires 10 children can not be allowed."

117.title: BJP Mahila Morcha member dies by suicide in Kerala, blames BJP leader
117.article_body: A BJP Mahila Morcha member died by suicide after hanging herself in her house in Kerala's Palakkad and blamed a local BJP leader in her suicide note, police said. Her brother spoke to a TV channel saying that the leader used her, adding other women are in the same situation. An FIR has been filed and probe has been launched.

118.title: Decomposed body of 21-yr-old woman found inside sack in Gr Noida
118.article_body: A 21-year-old woman's decomposed body was found stuffed and tied inside a sack in a house in Greater Noida's Sector Gamma 1 on Saturday night. The deceased, Pooja Bharti, hailed from Bihar and was reportedly preparing for a government job exam. According to police, Bharti was sharing the flat with a man, who is absconding since her body was found.

119.title: Hemsworth's 'Thor: Love and Thunder' earns ₹64.80 cr in 4 days in India
119.article_body: Chris Hemsworth-starrer 'Thor: Love and Thunder' has earned ₹64.80 crore in India within four days of its release. Film trade analyst Taran Adarsh took to Twitter to share the box office figures of the Taika Waititi directorial, writing that it earned ₹18.20 crore on Thursday and collected ₹11.40 crore, ₹16.80 crore, ₹18.40 crore on Friday, Saturday and Sunday respectively.

120.title: Kerala Minister R Bindu donates gold bangle for kidney patient's treatment
120.article_body: Kerala Minister R Bindu has donated one of her gold bangles for the treatment of a kidney patient who has to undergo transplant. Bindu was attending a meeting in Irinjalakuda area of Thrissur district of a medical aid committee for kidney transplantation and removed one of her bangles to give it as first donation for the patient's treatment.

121.title: India's inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June: Poll
121.article_body: India's retail inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June, a Reuters poll found. The poll of 42 economists showed inflation, as measured by the consumer price index (CPI), was steady at an annual 7.03% in June, as compared to 7.04% in May. Forecasts for the data, due on July 12, ranged from 6.45% to 7.70%.

122.title: 14 students score 100 percentile in JEE Main session 1, Sneha Pareek only girl topper
122.article_body: Fourteen students have scored perfect 100 percentile in JEE Main 2022 session 1. Notably, Sneha Pareek from Assam is the only girl topper. The other toppers are Jasti Yashwanth VVS, Aniket Chattopadhyay, Dheeraj Kurukunda, Rupesh Biyani, Koyyana Suhas, Penikalapati Ravi Kishore, Polisetty Karthikeya, Kushagra Srivastava, Mrinal Garg, Sarthak Maheshwari, Navya, Boya Haren Sathvik and Saumitra Garg.

123.title: Zubair sent to 14-day judicial custody by UP court for allegedly sharing false news
123.article_body: Fact-checker Mohammed Zubair was remanded to 14-day judicial custody by a Lakhimpur Kheri court in UP on Monday, days after Supreme Court granted him five-day bail. Zubair has been remanded in a case that was filed last year. A local TV journalist had lodged a police complaint alleging that Zubair circulated false news to disturb communal harmony.

124.title: IMF made us dance to its tune but hasn't released $6 bn loan: Pak minister
124.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah said that the IMF hasn't released the tranche of the $6 billion bailout package even though it made the country "dance to its tune". Sanaullah said that the country is currently going through a difficult situation in terms of its economy and the government had accepted the IMF terms which they "weren't in favour of".

125.title: Transgender, 9 others booked for attacking female YouTuber in Pune
125.article_body: A transgender person has been booked along with at least nine other people in Pune for alleged attempted assault on a woman who runs a YouTube channel, officials said on Sunday. The primary accused has been identified as Sagar Popat Shinde alias Shivlaxmi Zalte. The accused persons allegedly attacked the woman, accusing her of spreading false information about them.

126.title: Sri Lankan Prez orders 'smooth' distribution of LPG amid protests
126.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has ordered officials to ensure the "smooth" distribution of 3,700 metric tonnes of LPG received by the country, his office said on Sunday. This comes as the country is facing a shortage of fuel amid a worsening economic crisis. Rajapaksa's location is unknown since protesters entered his office and official residence.

127.title: I was molested by my cousins in India while growing up: Singer-actress Monica Dogra
127.article_body: In a recent interview where she talked about being pansexual, Indian-American singer-actress Monica Dogra revealed she was molested by her cousins in India while growing up. Dogra added she was also touched inappropriately by a family friend in her sleep. While talking about her sexuality, she said, "Growing up, I was ashamed of my gender for the most part."

128.title: Every minute Biden is late, he'll get 1 less minute with me: Uber ex-CEO in leaked 2016 text
128.article_body: Uber's ex-CEO Travis Kalanick's text to a colleague in 2016, after then-US Vice President Joe Biden was late to a meeting with him, has surfaced as part of the leaked documents obtained by The Guardian. "I've had my people let him know that every minute late he is, is one less minute he'll have with me," Kalanick's text message read.

129.title: Usman Khawaja mocks Kapil Dev's 'bench Kohli in T20Is' remark, says 'Australia agrees'
129.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja mocked ex-India captain Kapil Dev's 'bench Virat Kohli in T20Is' remark.  "Averages 50 at almost 140 [strike rate]. Good call. Australia agrees," wrote Khawaja with a couple of 'tears of laughter' emojis. Khawaja was responding to ICC's post on Instagram wherein Kapil suggested that Kohli's reputation shouldn't decide his place in the side.

130.title: Pic of 500-million-year-old fossilised brain of 3-eyed predator released
130.article_body: The fossilised brain of a creature with three eyes, that lived 500 million years ago is being studied by scientists. Pictures of the remains of the brain and nerves of the marine predator called Stanleycaris have been released. "The details are so clear it's as if we're looking at an animal that died yesterday," said a researcher on the fossil.

131.title: Was left speechless by some of his shots: Reece Topley on Suryakumar
131.article_body: England pacer Reece Topley, who was named 'Player of the Match' for his performance in the third T20I against India, has said he was left speechless by some of Suryakumar Yadav's shots during his 117-run innings in the game. "[It] was an unbelievable knock from the Indian side," he added. Suryakumar slammed 14 fours and 6 sixes in his innings.

132.title: IIT graduates' startup Vegrow raises $25 mn in Series B round
132.article_body: Founded by IIT alumni, B2B marketplace Vegrow, has raised $25 million in its Series B funding round. The round was led by Prosus Ventures and saw participation from existing investors Matrix Partners India, Elevation Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Ankur Capital. The startup helps bridge the demand and supply for fruits by bringing buyers and traders on a singular platform.

133.title: India is playing a big role for Sri Lanka: Jayasuriya amid economic crisis
133.article_body: Amid economic and political crisis in Sri Lanka, former cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya said that India is playing a big role for the country. "India, being very helpful from the start of crisis, has given aide. We are thankful," he added. India earlier said that it has extended this year itself "an unprecedented support of over $3.8 billion" to Sri Lanka.

134.title: Ignored cartilage tear for 1.5 yrs, I've stress fracture now: Vivek Agnihotri
134.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director, Vivek Agnihotri, has opened up about the cartilage tear in his knee. The filmmaker said he has finally started his knee therapy after suffering the injury last year. Sharing a picture of his bandaged knee, Vivek wrote on Twitter, "Finally, knee therapy begins. Fully ignored Meniscus (cartilage tear) for 1.5 yrs...Now I also have stress fracture."

135.title: 'Avengers: Endgame' directors to visit India for 'The Gray Man' premiere
135.article_body: Director duo Joe and Anthony Russo, aka Russo Brothers, will be in India for the premiere of their upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. The filmmakers, known for 'Avengers: Infinity War' and 'Avengers: Endgame', will be joining Dhanush for the premiere in Mumbai. In a video message, Joe and Anthony said, "We're so excited to be coming to India...see you soon."

136.title: 2nd seeds Krejcikova and Siniakova win 2nd Wimbledon women's doubles title
136.article_body: Second seeds Barbora Krejcikova and Katerina Siniakova won their second Wimbledon doubles title after beating top seeds Elise Mertens and Shuai Zhang 6-2, 6-4 on Sunday. It was the Czech pair's fifth Grand Slam doubles title and second this year. They won the Australian Open in January. Krejcikova and Siniakova won their first Wimbledon in 2018.

137.title: Disqualify MLAs Michael Lobo, Digambar Kamat: Goa Congress to Speaker
137.article_body: The Goa Congress has petitioned the Speaker of the Assembly to disqualify its MLAs Digambar Kamat and Michael Lobo under the anti-defection law. Earlier on Sunday, it removed Lobo as the Leader of Opposition and claimed that a conspiracy was hatched by some of its own leaders with BJP. Reacting to the allegations, Kamat said he was "shocked and stunned".

138.title: Rain lashes several parts of Delhi after a hot & humid day
138.article_body: Parts of Delhi, including India Gate and ITO areas, received rainfall on Monday after a hot and humid day. The weather department has predicted thunderstorms accompanied by light to moderate intensity rain in the national capital. The Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter to alert people and advised commuters to plan their journey accordingly.

139.title: Suryakumar will be part of India's playing XI for T20 WC: Piyush Chawla
139.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla has said Suryakumar Yadav will definitely be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "100 per cent (he will be part of the squad). We all know what he can do in the middle-order...he just walks into the playing XI," stated Chawla. Suryakumar smashed his maiden T20I hundred against England on Sunday.

140.title: She's wonderful, I'm glad: Vaani Kapoor on comparison with Katrina Kaif
140.article_body: Reacting to her 'Shamshera' character being compared to Katrina Kaif's role in 'Thugs of Hindostan', actress Vaani Kapoor said that the former is wonderful. "I'm glad. If you're comparing me, please compare me to her beauty," she added. The actress further said that her part in 'Shamshera' is written in a different way and both films are very different.

141.title: Delhi govt to issue e-challans as 17 lakh vehicles lack PUC papers
141.article_body: Delhi government's transport department is set to notify vehicle owners who lack valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificates and begin issuing e-challans if certificates aren't obtained. Over 17 lakh vehicles lack PUC certificates in the national capital, officials said. A PUC certificate is a mandatory document that certifies that a vehicle's tailpipe emission is within permissible limits.

142.title: SC to hear plea alleging rise in attacks on Christian priests on July 15
142.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday has adjourned for July 15 the hearing of a plea alleging the rise in the number of attacks on Christian institutions and priests across India. The bench headed by Justice DY Chandrachud, said, "What you [petitioner's counsel] are saying is unfortunate if it is happening." The petition was filed by the Archbishop of Bangalore Diocese.

143.title: Firefighters battle 250 wildfires in Portugal; 29 people injured
143.article_body: Portugal's government on Sunday implemented a "state of contingency" as thousands of firefighters battled nearly 250 wildfires in the country. At least 29 people, including firefighters and civilians, were provided medical assistance to treat minor injuries, the country's state media RTP reported. This comes amid a heat wave in the country with expected temperatures of up to 43 degrees Celsius.

144.title: 'Koffee with Karan' is cringe binge, guilty pleasure viewing: Karan
144.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has called his celebrity talk show 'Koffee with Karan' "cringe binge" and "guilty pleasure viewing". "It's not meant to be breaking some cinematic barriers or intellectual barriers," the filmmaker added. He further said he is not taken seriously by intellectuals for his movies and for the show. "Everyone will watch it but they will criticise," Karan added.

145.title: We're with Congress: Michael Lobo after being removed as Leader of Oppn
145.article_body: A day after Goa Congress removed Michael Lobo as the Leader of Opposition (LoP), he said he told Goa AICC in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao that he was not interested in continuing as LoP. "We're with the Congress party," he added. Earlier, Rao said that Lobo and ex-Goa CM Digambar Kamat hatched a "conspiracy" to ensure defection of Congress in Goa.

146.title: Bank employee killed after being mistaken for a thief in Bengaluru
146.article_body: Two security guards allegedly killed a 27-year-old bank employee on the suspicion that he was a thief trying to enter an apartment complex in Bengaluru. The two guards have been arrested. The victim was assaulted with an iron rod and had received injuries on his head. He was a resident of Odisha who had come to Bengaluru for training.

147.title: Fake IPL in Gujarat organised to cheat Russian punters; labourers acted as cricketers
147.article_body: Gujarat Police have busted a fake IPL racket in the state with the matches being staged for punters from Russia. The fake IPL matches were played among farm labourers acting as cricketers, while a Harsha Bhogle mimic commentated on the matches. The bets on the matches were placed from Russian cities of Tver, Voronezh and Moscow through a Telegram channel.

148.title: Following violence, DMK-led state govt seals AIADMK headquarters in Chennai
148.article_body: The AIADMK headquarters, 'MGR Maaligai', in Chennai was sealed by the DMK-led Tamil Nadu government following the violence and vandalism that took place between the supporters of senior party leaders, Edappadi Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam. The action was taken by the revenue and police officials after Panneerselvam walked out of the office saying that he would approach the court.

149.title: 34 MMTS train services cancelled amid heavy rains forecast for Hyd
149.article_body: South Central Railway (SCR) cancelled 34 MMTS train services due to heavy rains forecast for Hyderabad. All the MMTS trains on the routes Lingampalli-Hyderabad, Hyderabad-Lingampalli, Falaknuma-Lingampalli, Lingampalli-Falaknuma, Secunderabad-Lingampalli, and Lingampalli-Secunderabad have been cancelled, SCR said in a statement. The meteorological department sounded red alert warning till Tuesday.

150.title: Won't make excuses, judge us by what we did in last 5 yrs: Uber on 'Uber files' leak
150.article_body: Responding to the 'Uber files' leak regarding its alleged malpractices, Uber admitted to its "mistakes" but said it had transformed since 2017 after current CEO Dara Khosrowshahi took over. It said, "We've not and won't make excuses for past behaviour that is clearly not in line with our present values...Judge us by what we’ve done over the last five years."

151.title: SRK shows love and respect to his co-actor, it can ruin your habit: Taapsee
151.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said that actor Shah Rukh Khan shows love and respect to his co-actors in his films. "[It] can truly ruin your habit," she added. "Most of my films end up being driven by my characters so I end up getting first credit. It happened long back that Shah Rukh sir started doing it," she further said.

152.title: We are getting oil at cheapest price; states must reduce prices: Jaishankar
152.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said that states must take some measures to reduce the fuel prices in their respective states. "Oil we are getting is the cheapest available in the global market and this makes our government reduce the price," Jaishankar said. "World today seeing us as a nation which stepped forward during the pandemic," he added.

153.title: Mumbai woman arrested for defrauding investment bank of ₹3.5 crore
153.article_body: A Mumbai woman was arrested by the Powai Police for defrauding a multinational investment bank of ₹3.5 crore. The accused, Manpreet Shahani (40), was an employee with the firm for 16 years and deceived them by fraudulently buying gift vouchers in the company's name, police said. Notably, Shahani used to buy extra vouchers and would later get them encashed.

154.title: Over 1,000 applications pending for SC/ST/OBC scholarships with Delhi govt
154.article_body: Over 1,000 applications for SC/ST/ OBC scholarships are pending with the Delhi government's education department by the end of 2021-22. The government's Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC has written a letter to the Director of Education (DoE) requesting that all "pending applications are verified immediately". Notably, 918 applications are pending for tuition fee reimbursement for 2021-22.

155.title: Uddhav writes to 15 Sena MLAs, thanks them for supporting: Report
155.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray reportedly wrote to 15 Shiv Sena MLAs, thanking them for their support during tough times, without surrendering to the pressure of threats or offers. He also called for a meeting with all Shiv Sena MPs at his residence 'Matoshree,' to take a decision on the next week's Presidential election, the report said.

156.title: Heavy rains uproot trees in 10 places across Pune, two cars damaged
156.article_body: As heavy rains lashed Pune, trees were uprooted in 10 places across the city on Sunday. Two cars were also damaged after trees fell on them amid the rains. Reports said that no casualties were reported in these incidents and the Pune fire brigade cleared the trees from roads. 13 trees were uprooted in the city on Friday.

157.title: Japan's ruling party wins Upper House polls after Abe's assassination
157.article_body: Japan's ruling party, Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), along with its coalition partner won a major victory in the Upper House elections on Sunday, days after the assassination of former PM Shinzo Abe. The LDP and its coalition partner now have a seat share of 146 out of the total 248. The country's PM Fumio Kishida welcomed the victory.

158.title: Sourav, Sehwag, Yuvraj all have been dropped when not in form: Venkatesh
158.article_body: Ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad has said all out-of-form players should be dropped irrespective of their reputation. "Sourav, Sehwag, Yuvraj, Zaheer, Bhajji (Harbhajan) all have been dropped when not in form...The yardsticks seem to have changed...there is rest for being out of form," he tweeted. Notably, Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested for West Indies ODIs.

159.title: Working on 'Shamshera' was a nightmare: Ranbir Kapoor
159.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said in an interview that working on 'Shamshera' was a nightmare. He added that it was the most physically draining film for him and his co-star Vaani Kapoor. "We were covered in dust. We were shooting in peak summer in Mumbai wearing woollen clothes. I also had a thick beard. So, it was really hard," said Ranbir.

160.title: Centre bound to honour commitment to Portugal, free Abu Salem after 25-year term: SC
160.article_body: The Supreme Court has said the Centre is bound to honour its commitment given to Portugal and release gangster Abu Salem on completion of his 25-year sentence in the 1993 Mumbai blasts case. The court however did not accept Salem's argument that his detention in Portugal should be considered while calculating 25 years of imprisonment. Salem was extradited in 2005.

161.title: 'House of Cards' actress Kate Mara expecting second child with Jamie Bell
161.article_body: Actress Kate Mara is expecting her second child with actor-husband Jamie Bell. The 'House of Cards' actress made the announcement in an Instagram post on Sunday. "There are three of us in this pic," Mara wrote alongside a photograph of herself and Bell holding hands. Mara and Bell are already parents to a daughter, who was born in 2019.

162.title: Rumours about me joining BJP spreading since 2017: Digambar Kamat
162.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said "rumours" about him joining BJP have been spreading since 2017. "If I wanted to go, I'd have gone. No one can stop me. But still, I led party from the front," he added. "I saw a video of the presser of Dinesh Gundu Rao (Goa AICC in-charge)...It has hurt me beyond words," he stated.

163.title: 23-year-old food delivery man killed in hit-and-run in Mohali
163.article_body: A 23-year-old food delivery man died on the Zirakpur-Panchkula flyover in Mohali’s Dhakoli after a speeding canter hit his motorcycle from behind on Saturday. The incident occurred when he was on his way to deliver food, an official said. The canter driver managed to escape. "We've the canter’s registration number and will be arresting the driver soon," the official added.

164.title: China warns Southeast Asian nations to not be used as 'chess pieces'
164.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi while speaking at Association of Southeast Asian Nations' (ASEAN) Secretariat, said, "We should insulate this region from geopolitical calculations…from being used as chess pieces from major power rivalry and from coercion." This comes after Yi met with US State Secretary Antony Blinken last week. "The future of our region should be in our...hands," he added.

165.title: Was nervous for 'Adipurush', didn't know what I was going to do: Kriti
165.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that she was nervous about taking up 'Adipurush'. "I didn't know what I was going to do and...how I was going to play part that holds so much importance in our religion and our history...With that weight, you also as an actor feel responsible because you're playing such an iconic character and a part," she added.

166.title: India must be ready to face upheaval due to AI: Rajnath Singh
166.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that India needs to work on artificial intelligence (AI) mechanism "extremely carefully" and it must be ready to face legal, ethical, political and economic upheaval that may follow due to this technology. "It should not be the case that a country or a group of countries establish their dominance on this technology," he added.

167.title: PM Modi unveils 6.5-metre-tall bronze National Emblem on top of new Parliament building
167.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday unveiled the National Emblem cast on the roof of the New Parliament Building, the government said. The bronze cast weighs around 9,500 kg and stands 6.5 metres tall, according to officials. "Historic Moment...Deeply privileged to witness the moment," Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted.

168.title: Won't take rest till we make Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu: AIADMK leader
168.article_body: Soon after Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK’s interim General Secretary, ex-state minister and AIADMK leader Natham R Viswanathan said, "We won't take rest till we make E Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu." Furthermore, he said, "O Panneerselvam has a dual face. He doesn't want anyone to have a good life." "I'm happy that he is out now," he stated.

169.title: Indian origin humans to travel to space next year: Union Minister
169.article_body: Union Minister of State for Ministry of Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh has said that the preparations for Gaganyaan, India's maiden human space mission, are complete and humans of Indian origin will go to space next year. The trials of the mission scheduled to take place in 2023 will be conducted by the end of this year, the minister said.

170.title: Everyone knows the bowler will bowl short to Shreyas: Parthiv Patel
170.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Shreyas Iyer could've taken more responsibility during his 119-run partnership with Suryakumar Yadav in the third T20I against England. He further said that Shreyas needs to work on his shot selection. "Everyone knows that bowler will bowl short to Shreyas...He has to decide whether to attack it or survive by taking singles," explained Parthiv.

171.title: LuLu's biggest mall with 11-storey parking, 15 eateries launched in Lucknow
171.article_body: The biggest mall of LuLu Group International has been inaugurated in Lucknow. The mall has an 11-storey parking facility for over 3,000 vehicles. It also has 15 fine-dine restaurants and cafes and a mega food court with 25 brand outlets. The food court has a seating capacity for 1,600 people. The mall also has a dedicated wedding shopping arena.

172.title: Parts of Hyderabad to face water supply disruption on July 13
172.article_body: Parts of Hyderabad will face water supply disruption for 24 hours from 6 am on July 13 due to construction works for a flyover at Al-Jubail Colony, Falaknuma. The areas that will be hit by water supply disruption include - Kishanbagh, Al-Jubail Colony, Santosh Nagar, Vinaynagar, Saidabad, Chanchalguda, Asmangadh, Yakutpura, Madannapet, Mahbub Mansion, Nallakunta, Aliabad and Balapur.

173.title: India projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year: UN report
173.article_body: India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year, according to a report by the UN which said that the world population is forecast to reach 8 billion by mid-November 2022. The latest projections by the UN suggest that the world's population could grow to around 8.5 billion in 2030 and 9.7 billion in 2050.

174.title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 5% as Adani Group enters 5G spectrum auction
174.article_body: Bharti Airtel shares declined nearly 5% during intraday trade on Monday. On Friday, Adani Group confirmed its participation in India's first 5G spectrum auction that is going to be held on July 26.
