348.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Telangana, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, coastal Karnataka, coastal Andhra Pradesh and Chhattisgarh on Monday. Red alert has been issued for several areas in these states. Meanwhile, very heavy rainfall is expected over Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh and interior Karnataka on Monday, according to IMD.

349.title: Japan votes for key polls days after ex-PM Abe's assassination
349.article_body: Japanese voters on Sunday cast their ballots in parliamentary election for the upper house, two days after ex-PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated while campaigning in Nara. Abe was shot while campaigning for a candidate from his Liberal Democratic Party. "We must never allow violence to suppress speech during elections, which are the foundation of democracy," Japan PM Fumio Kishida said.

350.title: Motherhood is an honour, it made me a complete artiste: Neeti Mohan
350.article_body: Singer Neeti Mohan has stated in an interview that motherhood is an honour, adding that she feels more complete as an artiste. The singer further said, "Motherhood has made me a better time manager, it has made me more productive." Neeti and her husband actor Nihaar Pandya welcomed their first child Aryaveer on June 2, 2021.

351.title: Dressing up not a crime: Assam CM as man dressed as Shiva gets arrested
351.article_body: After a man was arrested in Assam's Nagaon for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by playing Lord Shiva in a street play, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted, "Dressing up is not a crime unless offensive material is said." "Nukkad natak (street play) on current issues is not blasphemous...Appropriate order has been issued to Nagaon Police," Sarma added.

352.title: TN CM 'anti-Hindu', practices religion-based politics: BJP leader
352.article_body: BJP leader K Laxman on Sunday alleged that Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin was "anti-Hindu" and accused him of practising "religion-based politics". "Stalin who always opposes Hindutva should understand that religion is man's belief and faith and PM Narendra Modi has never linked religion with politics," he said. BJP has never done politics based on religion, he added.

353.title: Man's skull explodes after he lights firework on his head in US
353.article_body: A 43-year-old man, Pablo Ruiz, died in US' Texas after he lit a firework on top of his head recently. Investigators believe the firework exploded from the bottom of the tube and pierced the top of his skull. His friend, who witnessed the incident, said Ruiz had been drinking when he lit the mortar-style firework from his head.

354.title: Dalit boy gets ₹2.5cr scholarship to study in US, is son of daily wager from Bihar
354.article_body: A 17-year-old Dalit boy from Bihar has been awarded a ₹2.5 crore scholarship to study at the US' Lafayette College. Prem Kumar, who is the son of a daily wage worker, is one among only six students selected from across the world for the prestigious 'Dyer Fellowship'. Kumar will fly to Pennsylvania to study Mechanical Engineering and International Relations.

355.title: 53 Shiv Sena MLAs of Shinde, Thackeray factions get show-cause notices
355.article_body: Maharashtra Legislature Secretary has issued show-cause notices to 53 of the state's 55 Shiv Sena MLAs – 39 of Eknath Shinde-led faction and 14 of Uddhav Thackeray camp. Both factions have accused each other of defying the party whip during the Speaker's election and trust vote on July 3 and 4, respectively, seeking disqualification of the legislators from both sides.

356.title: Was once hit on by a girl in Goa, felt nice about it: Taapsee Pannu
356.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu revealed that she was once hit on by a girl in Goa. "I didn't realise it first...my friends told me...'she's hitting on you'," Taapsee said, adding, "I think I felt nice...because you always think...girls only find faults in other girls...So it was like she finds me nice, oh nice...I felt nice about it at that point."

357.title: It's sad Wimbledon didn't have 2nd semis, but Nadal knows his body: Djokovic
357.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal pulling out of Wimbledon due to an abdominal injury, Novak Djokovic said it's sad that the tournament didn't have a second semi-final but Nadal knows "his body the best". He added, "I give Nadal a lot of credit for the way he fought and won...with that injury." Nadal had won quarter-final despite a seven millimetre tear.

358.title: UP govt taking measures to ban sale of meat in open on Kanwar Yatra routes
358.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is taking measures to restrict the sale of meat in open along the routes fixed for Kanwar Yatra. The local, district and police administration are reaching out to meat traders to ensure this, said officials. This year, the Kanwar Yatra will take place after a gap of two years due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

359.title: Elon Musk is a bullsh*t artist, he's not going to buy Twitter: Donald Trump
359.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "bullsh*t artist" and claimed that Musk isn't going to buy Twitter. "He's got a pretty rotten contract, I looked at his contract," Trump said, referring to Musk's $44 billion merger contract to buy Twitter. On Saturday, Musk terminated the deal to acquire Twitter citing several reasons, including spam accounts.

360.title: Video shows protesters counting cash they found at Sri Lanka President's mansion
360.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which purportedly shows anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka counting the cash that they claimed were found at the President's official residence. Notably, protesters who stormed President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's mansion on Saturday claimed to have recovered "millions of rupees" from his residence amid the country's worst economic crisis.

361.title: I find people asking me more about 'Koffee with...' than about my films: Johar
361.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, while speaking about his show 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I find people asking me more about 'Koffee With Karan' than about my movies, which I take as...compliment at that moment." "So while one part of me is elated, one part of me also needs to...make sure that the filmmaker...graph needs to move forward too," he added.

362.title: US Bitcoin mining firm Compass fires 15% staff, cuts exec pay by 50%
362.article_body: US-based Bitcoin mining company Compass Mining has fired 15% of its staff, Co-founders Thomas Heller and Paul Gosker announced. The company's senior employees and executive team have taken pay cuts of up to 50%, they added. This comes amid the falling price of Bitcoin. "Given recent market downturn...we had to take a hard look at our spend," the Co-founders said.

363.title: D-Mart owner Avenue Supermarts' profit jumps 490% to ₹680 cr in Q1
363.article_body: D-Mart owner and operator Avenue Supermarts reported a profit after tax (PAT) of almost ₹680 crore in Q1 of Financial Year 2023, after marking a jump of around 490% from ₹115.13 crore year-on-year. The Mumbai-based company also reported over 94% increase in its revenue from operations which came in at ₹9,806.89 crore.

364.title: Prabhas weighed 100 kg for 'Baahubali', had 8 meals a day: Trainer
364.article_body: Professional bodybuilder Laxman Reddy spoke about how Prabhas trained to play the role of Amarendra Baahubali in the 'Baahubali' films. "Prabhas weighed almost 100 kg," he said adding that the actor used to have eight meals a day. "In the evenings, we had weight training sessions, which included deadlifts, squats, bench press, and other rigorous exercises," said Reddy.

365.title: China fines Alibaba, Tencent for violating anti-monopoly rules
365.article_body: China imposed fines on Alibaba and Tencent along with other firms for failing to comply with anti-monopoly rules on disclosure of transactions. China's State Administration for Market Regulation released a list of 28 deals that violated the rules, out of which five involved Alibaba and 12 involved Tencent. The maximum potential fine in each case stands at $74,688, Reuters reported.

366.title: End voting rights for Muslims if they aren't allowed to vote: Khan
366.article_body: The right to vote for Muslims should be ended if community members are not allowed to exercise this right, said Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan. His remark came in the backdrop of bypolls for Rampur and Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituencies, during which Muslim voters were harassed and the total voting percentage in the Rampur district was only 32%, claimed Khan.

367.title: 'Agnipath' complements IAF’s long-term vision of ‘lean & lethal’ force: IAF chief
367.article_body: Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari said the 'Agnipath' scheme complements IAF's long-term vision of being a "lean and lethal" force with the best manpower. "We strongly believe that the men and women behind the machine make all the difference when it matters," he added. He said that 13 teams will take care of enrolment, employment, assessment and training of recruits.

368.title: Man cheats 200 people of ₹1.5 lakh each in Hyderabad, arrested
368.article_body: Hyderabad's Medipally Police have arrested a 35-year-old man accused of cheating 200 people of ₹1.5 lakh each on pretext of a business scam. According to police, the accused, identified as Adula Bala Swamy Goud, had sold machinery used to make cotton wicks to victims and promised to buy the products. Goud sold the machines to victims at ₹1.5 lakh each.

369.title: They enjoyed luxury, we suffered: SL woman as protesters occupy president's home
369.article_body: A 61-year-old handkerchief seller in Sri Lanka who entered the president's palace in Colombo after it was stormed by protesters on Saturday, said, "I've never seen a place like this in my life." She added, "They enjoyed super luxury while we suffered. We were hoodwinked." President and PM's houses have been occupied amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis since independence.

370.title: I think Rafael Nadal didn't want to face Kyrgios at 80%: McEnroe
370.article_body: Ex-world number one John McEnroe has said Rafael Nadal pulled out of Wimbledon 2022 because he didn't want to face Nick Kyrgios in the semi-final. "Nadal beat Taylor Fritz at 80%...but Kyrgios is dominating Wimbledon...do you really think Rafael wanted to play him at 80%? Something tells me he didn't want that," stated McEnroe. Nadal had suffered an abdominal tear.

371.title: 5 armed men barge into Haryana Cong MLA's house, beat up his cook
371.article_body: Five armed men allegedly barged into Congress MLA Kuldeep Vats' house in Haryana's Pataudi and beat up his cook, police said. Police added that a case has been registered against the accused. "They told me to warn the MLA that he should not make any comments against gangsters or he will face the fate as Sidhu Moosewala," the cook said.

372.title: Impartial judicial system biggest need for democracy: Nitin Gadkari
372.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said that an impartial and fair judicial system is the biggest requirement for a free and fair democracy. "During cabinet meetings...I often tell the law minister and prime minister that whatever the decision may be, it is the right of the judiciary to give the decision and it should not be influenced by anybody," he said.

373.title: Babul Supriyo appointed as Trinamool Congress' national spokesperson
373.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) appointed its MLA Babul Supriyo as the national spokesperson of the party. Taking to Twitter, the former union minister thanked TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee and wrote, "Shall do my very best to live up to the responsibility entrusted upon me." In April, Supriyo won Ballygunge assembly seat on TMC's ticket.

374.title: 1Pay gets RBI's in-principle nod to operate as payment aggregator
374.article_body: Fintech startup 1Pay Mobileware has become one of the first companies in India to receive in-principle approval from RBI to operate as a payment aggregator. The company is backed by ex-Goldman Sachs MD Sanjiv Shah, and Sanjay Gaitonde. "1Pay is creating...payments platform for the unorganised sector that empowers them to accept and make digital payments," the firm's Co-founder Gaitonde said.

375.title: History-sheeter arrested for trying to extort ₹1 cr from Pune jeweller
375.article_body: A 28-year-old history-sheeter was arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹1 crore from a jeweller in Pune district's Shirur. The accused made the extortion call using a phone he had stolen from a Pandharpur-bound Warkari. He allegedly said that he was calling from "DK Group" and threatened to kill the jeweller and his family members if the money wasn't given.

376.title: WhatsApp to let users sync chats across multiple smartphones: Report
376.article_body: According to a report by WABetaInfo, online messaging platform WhatsApp will soon let users sync their chats across multiple smartphones. This would allow users to use the same WhatsApp number or account on different smartphones without requiring to have an active internet connection on their primary phone, the report added. Currently, users can only sync chats on tablets and desktops.

377.title: SpiceXpress to be hived off from SpiceJet by August 1st week: CMD
377.article_body: SpiceJet CMD Ajay Singh has said banks and shareholders have given their approval to hive off cargo and logistics company SpiceXpress from SpiceJet airline. The bifurcation will take place by the first week of August, he added. This comes after SpiceJet said in August 2021 it was transferring its logistics business on a slump sale basis to its subsidiary SpiceXpress.

378.title: We have won Wimbledon: Russian tennis chief on Kazakh player Rybakina's win
378.article_body: Russian Tennis Federation (RTF) president Shamil Tarpishchev claimed credit for Kazakh player Elena Rybakina's women's singles title win at Wimbledon. "It's very nice. Well done Rybakina. We've won Wimbledon," Tarpishchev said. Rybakina, born and brought up in Russia's Moscow, switched nationalities to Kazakhstan in 2018. Notably, Russian players were banned from participating in Wimbledon.

379.title: Paintings, sculptures worth ₹40 crore seized by CBI in DHFL bank fraud case
379.article_body: The CBI seized paintings and sculptures worth ₹40 crore during its searches at three locations in connection with India's biggest banking fraud of ₹34,615 crore by DHFL. The seized artworks reportedly include paintings by famous artists Tyeb Mehta and Manjit Bawa, worth ₹27 crore and ₹7.7 crore, respectively. Promoters allegedly bought artworks worth ₹55 crore using diverted funds, CBI said.

380.title: Congress expresses solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people: Sonia Gandhi
380.article_body: A day after the protests against economic crisis reached a peak in Sri Lanka, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Sunday issued a statement, saying the Congress party expresses its solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people in this moment of grave crisis. "We hope that India will continue to assist the people and government of Sri Lanka," the statement read.

381.title: India's economy needs to grow 8-10% in 25 years: Singapore minister
381.article_body: Singapore's Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies Tharman Shanmugaratnam said that India's economy must grow by 8-10% in the next 25 years to raise the average income of people across the country and create more jobs. Shanmugaratnam added that India needs to focus simultaneously not only on job growth but also on productivity.

382.title: Withdrawal rate falls as FPIs take out ₹4,000 crore in July so far
382.article_body: The pace of selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) has declined as they withdrew over ₹4,000 crore from Indian equity markets in the first eight days of July. This comes after a net withdrawal of ₹50,203 crore in June, the highest net outflow since March 2020. Recently, the RBI announced several measures to boost foreign exchange inflows.

383.title: Hero MotoCorp CEO Munjal steps down as CII President-Designate
383.article_body: Hero MotoCorp Chairman and CEO Pawan Munjal has stepped down as President-Designate of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) for 2022-23. Munjal cited domestic and global business commitments as the reason behind stepping down. The CII has elected TVS Group's R Dinesh as Munjal's replacement. ITC Chairman and MD Sanjiv Puri has been elected as Vice President.

384.title: Refrain from commenting about Musk's deal: Twitter to staff as it vows legal action
384.article_body: Twitter has asked its staff to not publicly comment about Elon Musk's $44 billion collapsed deal. Citing it as an ongoing legal matter, it said employees "should refrain from Tweeting, Slacking, or sharing any commentary" about the merger agreement. Meanwhile, Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor said the board will pursue legal action against Musk to enforce the merger.

385.title: Metallica pays tribute to 'Stranger Things' character Eddie Munson
385.article_body: Heavy metal band Metallica recently paid a tribute to television series 'Stranger Things' character Eddie Munson which is portrayed by actor Joseph Quinn. The series featured Eddie performing the band's song 'Master of Puppets' in an episode. Metallica posted a video on TikTok and Instagram recording a duet of performing the song along with the clip of Eddie's performance.

386.title: No pressure now, Rohit & Virat can take time to score: Parthiv on 3rd Eng T20I
386.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said the third and final T20I against England is a good opportunity for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to take time and score "big runs". "Rohit is looking good, but he's not able to convert 30s. As for Kohli, the runs are not coming," stated Parthiv. Kohli scored 1(3) in the second England T20I.

387.title: Seems someone is forcing him to go, hit: Ajay Jadeja on Kohli's dismissal
387.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in second T20I against England, Ajay Jadeja said, "The way we saw Kohli today, it seems someone is forcing him to go and hit, we've not seen this for 15 years." Richard Gleeson removed Kohli(1) after the India batter hit the ball high in the air, with Dawid Malan taking the catch at backward point.

388.title: Delhi sets up control room to monitor plastic ban, ₹1 lakh fine
388.article_body: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee has set up a control room to monitor the implementation of the ban on single-use plastic items and will start fining those violating it from Monday, officials said. The action will include a fine of up to ₹1 lakh or a jail term of up to five years, under the Environment Protection Act, 1986.

389.title: Never thought my career was over: Bhuvneshwar on facing injuries
389.article_body: India bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar recalled his injury woes before making his India comeback and said he never thought his career was over. "I was working with the physios, trainers...doing my thing...when you're out of the game you're never confident," he stated. "Luckily...(I'm) playing for India again," he added. Bhuvneshwar was Player of the Match in the second T20I versus England.

390.title: India sends 44,000 MT urea to Sri Lanka to curb food crisis
390.article_body: India on Sunday handed more than 44,000 metric tonnes (MT) of urea to Sri Lanka amid latter's economic crisis. The assistance, which is part of India's credit line to the country, is aimed at supporting Sri Lankan farmers, the Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka said. Over 6 million Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity amid inflation, UN has said.

391.title: 3 arrested for spreading 'fake news' on Jagannath Rath Yatra via YouTube
391.article_body: Three youths were arrested from Gujarat for allegedly spreading "fake news" on YouTube channels about an attack on Jagannath Rath Yatra. The social media monitoring cell of Cyber Crime Branch came across YouTube channels, while keeping a watch on various platforms on July 2. There was an attempt to disturb peace and social harmony through YouTube channels, the police said.

392.title: Rare 'rain of animals' witnessed in Telangana's Jagtial; video surfaces
392.article_body: Residents of Telangana's Jagtial town witnessed a rare weather phenomenon as fish rained from the sky. 'Rain of animals' is a phenomenon that occurs when small water animals like frogs, crabs, and fish are swept up in waterspouts or drafts that occur on the surface of the earth. They are then rained down at the same time as the rain.

393.title: 6 killed as rockets hit apartment building in Ukraine's Donbas
393.article_body: At least six people were killed and over 30 people are feared trapped after Russian rockets hit a five-storey residential building in Chasiv Yar, a city in Ukraine's Donbas region, regional governor has said. The strike, which reportedly took place on Saturday, comes even as Russia denies deliberately attacking civilians. Notably, several regions of Donbas are now under Russian control.

394.title: Blessings of Goddess Kali are always with India: PM Modi
394.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing the centenary celebrations of Swami Atmasthananda on Sunday, said the blessings of Goddess Kali are always with the country. This comes amid a controversy over TMC MP Mahua Moitra's remarks on Goddess Kali, following which BJP filed several police complaints against her. "To me, Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting Goddess," Moitra had earlier said.

395.title: Protesters enact WWE on Sri Lanka Prime Minister's bed, video goes viral
395.article_body: A video has gone viral showing protesters enacting WWE on a bed at Sri Lanka Prime Minister's residence. In the video, several intruders can be seen imitating wrestling moves, while others can be seen cheering them up. Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Saturday announced that he is resigning from his post amid the economic crisis in the country.

396.title: BJP trying to poach our MLAs, intimidate them: AICC Goa in-charge
396.article_body: AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Sunday said, "All the MLAs of Congress party are intact but BJP is trying to poach our MLAs and intimidate them." Furthermore, he said, "Yesterday we had a CLP meeting in Goa…All our MLAs are intact." Meanwhile, Goa Congress leader Michael Lobo refuted the "rumours" that few Congress leaders are joining BJP.

397.title: Film initiative started by TN govt, movies to be shown in 13,000 schools
397.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has launched an initiative to screen films in government schools. In the state's 13,210 schools, a nodal teacher would facilitate the process. The nodal teacher has to prepare a synopsis of the film and ensure the screening meets all criteria. "The government had initiated counselling programmes to improve [kids'] mental health," Minister for School Education said.

398.title: When he collared me & asked why I'm not making Paani: Shekhar on pic with Cruise
398.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur has shared a throwback picture of himself with Tom Cruise from the time the actor visited India in 2011. Sharing the picture, Shekhar wrote, "When #TomCruise collared me and asked...why I'm not making #Paani." The picture was reportedly clicked at a party organised by Anil Kapoor while Tom was in India to promote 'Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol'.

399.title: No justification provided: Pak's Imad Wasim on losing central contract
399.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Imad Wasim said no justification has been given to him as to why he didn't get a central contract from Pakistan Cricket Board. "Reasons are given to me, but I'm unsatisfied with them," he added. "One reason given to me was regarding the positive influence on the team. I don't think I have a negative influence," he stated.

400.title: Pune to have normal water supply till July 26: PMC
400.article_body: PMC has decided to continue its normal supply till July 26 after water storage in the four dams supplying water to Pune increased to over 7 TMC, officials said on Sunday. PMC had previously said it will start an alternate day water supply from July 4 to July 11 because of the deficit rain in June.

401.title: Man threatens IAS officer over son-in-law's transfer from B'luru; held
401.article_body: A man has been arrested from Bengaluru for allegedly making threat calls to IAS officer Munish Moudgil over his driver's transfer to Kolar. Moudgil's driver is the son-in-law of the accused. The accused had posed as Karnataka Excise Minister K Gopalaiah's personal secretary and threatened to transfer the officer from his present department and started shouting at him.

402.title: Ebden and Purcell win Wimbledon men's doubles title in 4 hours 11 minutes
402.article_body: Australia's Matt Ebden and Max Purcell defeated defending champions Mate Pavic and Nikola Mektic of Croatia 7-6(7-5), 6-7(3-7), 4-6, 6-4, 7-6(10-2) to win their first Grand Slam men's doubles title at Wimbledon on Saturday. They won the final in four hours 11 minutes. Ebden and Purcell saved a total of eight match points on the way to winning the title.
